Name: Aalt Mondria
Criminal_Penalty: life imprisonment, commuted to 18 years imprisonment
Notes: Dutch criminal and serial killer who committed four murders and was responsible for a large number of assaults. Mondria was considered extremely violent and aggressive. After a notorious murder of his girlfriend's 10-year-old son, he was sentenced to 18 years imprisonment in 1998, after initially receiving life imprisonment for three murders in 1978, for which he also received 15 years imprisonment.

Name: Abdallah Al-Hubal
Notes: Killed seven people after Yemeni unification; fled prison, then proceeded to kill a young couple and three more people; killed during a shootout with police.

Name: Abdufatto Zamanov
Notes: Killed people out of personal hostility; also raped two young girls; sentenced to life imprisonment.

Name: Abdullah Aksoy
Notes: Known as "The Monster of Çumra"; killed fifteen men in Çumra from 1962 to 1967 after having sexual intercourse with them, then buried their bodies in his home; committed suicide in prison before being tried.

Name: Abdullah Shah
Notes: Killed travelers on the road from Kabul to Jalalabad serving under Zardad Khan. Also killed his wife. Executed on April 20, 2004.

Name: Abraao Jose Bueno
Notes: Nurse who injected young children with sedatives until they stopped breathing. He would then alert doctors in an attempt to earn the respect of his colleagues for being the first one to notice that something was wrong. Convicted of 4 deaths and 4 more murder attempts to 110 years in prison.

Name: Abul Djabar
Notes: Killed 65 men and boys by strangling them with turbans while raping them. Suspected of over 300 murders. Sentenced to death and hanged on October 21, 1970.

Name: Adnan Colak
Criminal_Penalty: Six death sentences and 40 years imprisonment, commuted to life imprisonment
Notes: Killed 11 elderly women aged 68 to 95 and raped six others. Sentenced to death but commuted to life in prison after Turkey abolished the death penalty in 2004.

Name: Adolf Seefeldt
Nicknames: The Sman, Uncle Tick Tock, Uncle Adi, Adolf Seefeld
Notes: Known as the "Sandman"; sexually abused young boys in their sleep, then poisoned them; suspected of 100 murders in total. Executed by guillotine in 1936.
Weapon: strangled, strangulation, poison, poisoned, chloroform, beheaded, smothered

Name: Adolfo Constanzo And Sara Aldrete
Notes: "The Godparents of Matamoros". Leader and second-in-command of a drug-smuggling cult that abducted men to perform human sacrifices.

Name: Adrian Arroyo Gutierrez
Nicknames: The Southern Psychopath, The Indingent Killer
Notes: Known as "The Southern Psychopath"; raped and strangled drug-addicted sex workers in San José; sentenced to 110 years imprisonment.

Name: Ahmad Ahmadi
Notes: Responsible for killing political prisoners at Qasr prison during the reign of Reza Shah.

Name: Ahmad Suradji
Nicknames: Dukun ASNasib Kelewang, Datuk Maringgi, The Sorcerer
Notes: Suradji was convicted of strangling at least 42 women and girls in a series of ritual slayings he believed would give him magical powers. He was executed by firing squad in 2008.

Name: Aileen Wuornos
Nicknames: Sra Kretsch, Susan Lynn Blahovec, Lee Blahovec, Cammie Marsh Greene, Lori Kristine Grody
Notes: Sex worker that shot her victims at point blank range. Executed in 2002.
Weapon: gun, revolver, pistol, shot, shooting, club, hanging, car, vehicle, tortured

Name: Aino Nykopp-Koski
Notes: Nurse who killed five elderly patients using sedatives and opiates in Finland.

Name: Akira Nishiguchi
Notes: Fraudster, murdered two people while engaging in confidence scams and killed three others while on the run from justice. Hanged in 1970.

Name: Akku Yadav
Notes: Murdered at least three people and dumped their bodies on the railroad tracks; lynched by a mob of around 200 women.
Weapon: knife, stabbed, stabbing, burned, tortured, acid

Name: Albert Fish
Nicknames: Frank Howard, Thomas A. Sprague, Robert Hayden, John W. Pell
Notes: American serial killer and child rapist who confessed to three murders for which he was convicted and sentenced to death.
Weapon: knife, stabbed, stabbing, strangled, choked, burned, decapitated, tortured

Name: Alejandro Maynez
Notes: Killed at least two women in Ciudad Juárez, but believed to be 50. Supposedly, along with Ana Benavides and Melchor Máynez.
Weapon: knife, stabbed, stabbing, strangled, choked, burned, decapitated, tortured

Name: Aleksandr Rubel
Notes: He was intoxicated on gasoline vapour during his murders. Sentenced as a minor to the maximum punishment allowed by law — eight years imprisonment — he was released in 2006.

Name: Aleksey Sukletin
Nicknames: The Alligator, The Vassilyevo Cannibal, The Kazan Ogre, The Volga Alligator
Notes: Known as "The Alligator"; killed and cannibalized at least 7 girl and women from 1979 to 1985; executed 1987.

Name: Alexander Bychkov
Notes: Described in his personal diary how he killed 11 men who were alcoholics and tramps. Confessed to eating body parts of his victims. Found guilty of nine murders and sentenced to life imprisonment.

Name: Alexander Labutkin
Notes: Known as the "One-Armed Bandit"; killed people in the forest near the Prigorodny settlement using a revolver; executed 1935.

Name: Alexander Pichushkin
Nicknames: The Bitsa Park Maniac, The Chessboard Killer
Notes: Pichushkin was also known as the "Chessboard Killer". He was convicted of murdering 49 victims, and suspected of killing 60. He claimed to have murdered 62 people, because he did not know that two of his victims had survived; he stated that his goal was becoming Russia's most prolific serial killer. He was sentenced to life imprisonment.

Name: Alexander Sergeychik
Notes: Killed between six and 12 people under the influence of alcohol. Executed in 2007.
Weapon: pistol, shot, strangled, fire, burned, explosives, hanging, car

Name: Alexander Spesivtsev
Criminal_Penalty: Compulsory medical measures (1992) 10 years of imprisonment (1997) Involuntary commitment to the Kamyshin psychiatric hospital of federal service of completing punishment (1999)
Notes: Cannibal known as "The Novokuznetsk Monster"; admitted to 19 murders, but 82 bloody sets of clothes were found in his home, along with jewels and photographs of possibly unidentified victims. Found insane and interned in a mental hospital. His mother was sentenced to 16 years in prison for luring Spesivtsev's victims to their home.

Name: Alexander Tchayka
Notes: All the victims were women wearing fur coats and were stabbed multiple times (21 in one case).

Name: Alfred Gaynor
Notes: Crack cocaine addict. Killed nine women in Massachusetts. Sentenced to life in prison on May 19, 2000.

Name: Alfredo Galan
Nicknames: The Playing Card Killer, The Deck of Cards Killer, The Tokarev Killer
Notes: Shot random people over the course of three months, killing six and wounding three. He would sometimes leave a Spanish playing card at the scene of the crime as a signature.

Name: Ali Asghar Borujerdi
Notes: Known as "Asghar the Murderer". Borujerdi killed 33 young adults in Iraq and Iran. He was executed by hanging in 1934.

Name: Ali Kaya
Notes: Known as "The Baby Faced Killer"; responsible for 10 murders. Escaped from prison and later recaptured.

Name: Allan Joseph Legere
Criminal_Penalty: life imprisonment without the possibility of parole for 25 years
Notes: Convicted of killing five people in the Miramichi area, New Brunswick. Legere is now serving a life sentence Canada's only super maximum prison (Special Handling Unit).

Name: Altemio Sanchez
Nicknames: The Bike Path Killer, The Bike Path Rapist, Uncle Al
Notes: Known as "The Bike Path Rapist" for murdering three women and raping at least 14 others in and around the Buffalo, New York area. Sentenced to 75 years in prison without the possibility of parole.

Name: Amelia Sach And Annie Walters
Notes: Sach and Walters, known as the "Finchley baby farmers", would take in unwanted babies from young women, collect a fee and then discreetly murder the children. They were executed in 1903, the only double hanging of women in British history.

Name: Amir Qayyum
Notes: Known as "The brick killer". Killed 14 homeless men with rocks or bricks when they were asleep. Sentenced to death in May 2006.

Name: Amy Archer-Gilligan
Criminal_Penalty: death, later sent to insane asylum
Notes: A nursing home proprietor believed to have poisoned as many as 60 patients from her homes and her second husband. Charged with five murders originally, this was lowered to just one following her admission of guilt, and was found guilty of second degree murder. Died in a mental hospital in 1962.

Name: Anatoly Biryukov
Notes: Known as "The Hunter of Babies": responsible for the kidnappings and subsequent murders of five infants from Moscow in the fall of 1977.

Name: Anatoly Onoprienko
Nicknames: The Beast of Ukraine, The Terminator, Citizen O
Notes: Known as "The Beast of Ukraine", "The Terminator", and "Citizen O". Onoprienko was convicted of the murders of nine people in 1989, and 43 people in 1995–1996. He travelled throughout Europe illegally from 1990 to 1995; whether he killed during this time is unknown. He was sentenced to death, and was later commuted to imprisonment for life. He died from heart failure in 2013.
Weapon: shot, axe, hammer, fire, burned, sawed, car, tortured

Name: Anatoly Sedykh
Notes: Raped and killed women around Lipetsk, then robbed their corpses; sentenced to life imprisonment.

Name: Anatoly Slivko
Notes: As a member of the Young Pioneers (Soviet Boy Scouts), Slivko gained the trust of 43 young boys over almost three decades, asphyxiated them until they fell unconscious, and then ritually molested, filmed, photographed and resuscitated them. The seven boys that didn't wake up were dismembered and burned. Minutes before his execution in 1989, police asked Slivko for advice in the investigation of Andrei Chikatilo's crimes.

Name: Anatoly Utkin
Notes: Known as "Ulyanovsky maniac"; killed 8 girls and 1 man from 1968 to 1973; executed 1975.

Name: Anders Hansson
Notes: A Nurse Aide who poisoned victims with gevisol and ivisol. His actions were called "The Hospital Murders" (Swedish: Sjukhusmorden).

Name: Andras Pandy
Notes: Former clergyman nicknamed "Father Bluebeard", killed his two wives and four of his children with the help of a fifth he was having an incestuous affair with, and whom denounced him to the authorities seven years later. Sentenced to life imprisonment in 2002.

Name: Andre Crawford
Notes: Murdered 11 women between 1993 and 1999. Sentenced to life in prison.

Name: Andrei Chikatilo
Nicknames: The Butcher of Rostov, The Forest Strip Killer, The Red Ripper, The Rostov Ripper
Notes: Known as "The Butcher of Rostov", "The Red Ripper" or "The Rostov Ripper". Chikatilo was convicted of the murder of 53 women and children between 1978 and 1990. One man was previously convicted and executed for his first murder. Chikatilo was executed by gunshot in 1994.

Name: Andres Ulises Castillo Villarreal
Nicknames: The Chihuahua Ripper, The Urban Development Ripper
Notes: Known as "The Chihuahua Ripper"; drugged, raped and then killed men in Chihuahua; sentenced to 120 years imprisonment.

Name: Andrew Dawson
Criminal_Penalty: life imprisonment with a whole-life order
Notes: Killed an elderly man during a burglary in 1982. Following his release from prison, he stabbed two of his neighbors to death in separate incidents, describing himself as an "Angel of Mercy". He is currently Derby's only serial killer.

Name: Angel Makers Of Nagyrev
Notes: 26 women who poisoned their husbands (sometimes also their parents, lovers and children) with arsenic under the guidance of midwife Júlia Fazekas and her accomplice, Susi Oláh.

Name: Angel Maturino Resendiz
Notes: Known as the "Railroad Killer" because his killings were committed near the railroad tracks he used to traverse the country. He was charged with and/or confessed to 15 murders occurring from 1986 to 1999 in Texas, Florida, Illinois, Georgia, and Kentucky. He was also suspected in a 1997 California murder case and claimed two additional killings he refused to elaborate on. Executed by lethal injection in 2006.

Name: Angelo Buono Jr.
Notes: Convicted of strangling 10 women. One of the "Hillside Stranglers". Died in prison from a heart attack in 2002.

Name: Angus Sinclair
Notes: Scottish man who was originally convicted of murdering a 7-year-old girl when he was 16. As well as being convicted of the murders of three women in 1977 and 1978, police suspect he was responsible for four other murders of women in Glasgow in these years. Also a suspect in two other murders in 1970 and 1979 respectively.

Name: Anisio Ferreira De Sousa And Followers
Notes: Satanic ring that abducted, mutilated and sacrificed children in Altamira, Brazil. The leader, Ferreira de Sousa, was convicted to 77 years in prison for four murders and two attempted murders.

Name: Ann Arbor Hospital Killer
Notes: Poisonings of 10 patients at the Veteran's Administration Hospital in 1975. Filipino nurses Filipina Narciso and Leonora Perez were tried for the crimes.

Name: Anna Marie Hahn
Nicknames: Marie Felser, Marie Fisher, Arsenic Anna, The Blonde Borgia, Angel of Mercy
Notes: German-born murder-for-profit killer who poisoned five elderly men; executed in 1938.

Name: Ansis Kaupens
Notes: Army deserter who committed 30 robberies and killed 19 people; one of the most infamous Latvian criminals; executed by hanging in 1927.

Name: Anthony Allen Shore
Conviction: Child Molestation, Drug Possession, Kidnapping, Capital Murder, Seual Assault
Notes: Known as "The Tourniquet Killer"; convicted of strangling a woman with an unusual ligature in 1992 and confessed to killing three girls including two with same MO.

Name: Anthony Hardy
Notes: Known as the "Camden Ripper", killed and dismembered three sex workers in Camden, London in 2002. Police believe he could be responsible for the murders of three other sex workers in London in the 1990s and two others in Nottinghamshire. One other unsolved murder he was linked to was solved in 2011 when her former partner John Sweeney was convicted of her murder.

Name: Anthony Kirkland
Notes: Kirkland murdered four females between 2006 and 2009, three of them children, following a 16-year prison term for the murder of another woman.

Name: Anthony Sowell
Notes: Known as The Cleveland Strangler, he was convicted of killing 11 women between 2007 and 2009, and is suspected in another series of murders in the 1980s, with the two sets of killings separated by a 15-year stint in prison. Sentenced to death.

Name: Antoinette Scieri
Notes: Nurse who poisoned her elderly patients. Death sentence was commuted to life in prison and she died in prison.

Name: Antonio Luis Costa
Notes: Ex-soldier, suffocated three women (and mutilated the first one) in Santa Comba Dao.

Name: Antonis Daglis
Notes: "The Athens Ripper". A serial rapist with antecedents for violence, Daglis upgraded to raping, strangling and dismembering three sex workers with a hacksaw in 1992, and tried to kill six more women. In his trial he claimed to hate all sex workers. Killed himself in prison in 1997.

Name: Archibald Hall
Nicknames: Roy Fontaine, Killer Butler, Monster Butler
Notes: Called "The Monster Butler". Died in prison in 2002.
Weapon: shot, strangled, suffocated, chloroform, drowning, car, vehicle

Name: Arnfinn Nesset
Notes: Norwegian nurse and most prolific known serial killer in Scandinavian history, convicted in 1983 of poisoning at least 22 patients with Curacit; however he initially confessed to 27 murders; later he retracted his confessions and claimed he had killed 138 patients. Was released from prison in 2004 after serving 21 years, the maximum punishment possible by Norwegian law.

Name: Arnold Sodeman
Notes: Sodeman was convicted of murdering four children between 1930 and 1935. He would abduct children, gag them and tie their hands behind their back with their own clothing and then strangle them to death. Sodeman was one of the last eleven people to be executed in Victoria.

Name: Arthur Gary Bishop
Notes: Utah man who murdered five young boys; executed in 1988.
Weapon: revolver, shot, hammer, suffocated, drowned, car

Name: Arthur Shawcross
Nicknames: The Genesee River Killer, The Monster of the Rivers, The Rochester Strangler
Criminal_Penalty: life imprisonment without parole (or a term amounting to 250 years)
Notes: Committed arson and burglary, served two years of a five-year sentence. Within a year of his release, he raped and murdered two children in 1972. Under a plea bargain, he was sentenced to 25 years. Released after serving 14⁠1/2⁠ years, he began killing again a year later, targeting sex workers. Known as the "Genesee River Killer", "Genesee River Strangler", "Rochester Strangler", and "Monster of the Rivers", he strangled and battered his victims. Sentenced to life without parole. Died of cardiac arrest in 2008.

Name: Artyom Alexandrovich Anoufriev And Nikita Vakhtangovich Lytkin
Notes: Teenaged thrill-killers of random people.

Name: Asande Baninzi
Notes: Killed 18 people in three months, including a family of four; given 19 life sentences and 189 years of imprisonment.

Name: Atlanta Ripper
Notes: Unidentified serial killer(s) who killed at least 15 Atlanta women in 1911, possibly as many as 21 in total.

Name: Auto Shankar'S Gang
Notes: Nine men who collaborated to abduct and murder at least 6 teenage girls in Chennai; their bodies were cremated and thrown into the sea or buried under residential homes. Leader Auto Shankar and two accomplices were sentenced to death by hanging in 1991, his brother Auto Mohan to three consecutive life sentences in prison and five other collaborators to six months in prison.

Name: Axeman Of New Orleans
Notes: Unidentified serial killer of at least eight people in the New Orleans area from May 1918 to October 1919.

Name: B1 Butcher
Notes: Murdered at least five women between 2005 and 2007, with all murders related to the National Road B1.

Name: Baba Anujka
Nicknames: The Banat Witch, The Witch of Vladimirovac
Notes: Anujka was an accomplished amateur chemist from the village of Vladimirovac, Yugoslavia (modern day Serbia). She poisoned at least 50 people and possibly as many as 150 in the late 19th and early 20th centuries. Was sentenced to 15 years in prison in 1929 but released after eight years due to old age.

Name: Baekuni
Notes: Child rapist who killed young boys; initially sentenced to life imprisonment, but changed to the death sentence.

Name: Bai Baoshan
Notes: Robber who killed 15 people while robbing several police stations; executed by gunshot in 1998.

Name: Bandali Debs
Criminal_Penalty: 4x life imprisonment plus 27 years without parole[citation needed]
Notes: Convicted of the murder of Kirsty Harty at Upper Beaconsfield in 1997, and of the Moorabbin Police murders 14 months later to avoid arrest for a string of armed robberies; sentenced to three consecutive life sentences plus 27 years without the possibility of parole.

Name: Barnaul Maniac
Notes: The Barnaul Maniac was an unidentified Russian serial killer who murdered nine women and two girls in the city of Barnaul and the village of Buranovo. The main suspect was arrested in October 2000 but killed himself in jail in November that year.

Name: Beasts Of Satan
Notes: Cult members responsible for ritualistic murders, and are suspected in other cases, including suicides.

Name: Bela Kiss
Notes: Evaded arrest and conviction after the discovery of 24 bodies hidden in large metal drums on his property in 1916. At that time he was serving in the Austro-Hungarian Army, and deserted when the military was notified of the murders by civilian authorities. His final whereabouts and fate are unknown, as is his final victim count.

Name: Belize Ripper
Notes: The Belize Ripper was an unidentified Belizean serial killer who abducted and murdered five young girls in Belize City between 1998 and 2000.

Name: Belle Gunness
Notes: Norwegian-born murder-for-profit killer who murdered her suitors and relatives in Indiana. High possibility of committing over 40 murders. May have faked her own death in the fire that destroyed her home in 1908; her children had died of strychnine poisoning before the fire, and the woman's body found next to them was decapitated and, reportedly, smaller than Gunness' own. Ultimate fate unknown.

Name: Benjamin Atkins
Nicknames: The Woodward Corridor Killer, The HighlPark Strangler, Tony
Notes: Known as "The Woodward Corridor Killer". Raped and strangled his victims before abandoning their bodies in vacant buildings. Died in prison in 1997, age 29, from AIDS.

Name: Benjamin Geen
Criminal_Penalty: life imprisonment with a minimum tariff of 30 years
Notes: Nurse convicted in 2006 of murdering two patients and causing grievous bodily harm to another 15 at Horton General Hospital in Banbury, Oxfordshire between 2003 and 2004. Induced illness in the patients with overdoses of drugs, in order to enjoy the 'thrill' of resuscitating them. Given 17 life sentences and ordered to serve at least 30 years imprisonment. 9 other cases were originally investigated.

Name: Bernhard Prigan
Notes: Killed women near highways; confessed to a total of 16 murders.

Name: Bertha Gifford
Notes: Found not guilty by reason of insanity of three arsenic poisonings and suspected of 14 other killings, mostly children, in Missouri.

Name: Beverley Allitt
Criminal_Penalty: 13 life sentence(s), 4 counts of murder, 5 counts of attempted murder, 6 counts of GBH
Notes: Convicted of murdering four children and attacking another six in the Lincolnshire hospital where she worked as a nurse. Given 13 life sentences.

Name: Bian Kuang, Fu Xinyuan And Luo Lianshun
Notes: Manufacturing 51 cases of murder, robbery, rape, killing 41 people. Bian Kuang personally killed 39 people.

Name: Billy Glaze
Nicknames: Jesse Coulter, Jesse Sitting Crow, Butcher Knife Billy
Notes: Known as "Butcher Knife Billy". Killer convicted of raping and murdering three Native American sex workers in Minneapolis in 1986 and 1987.

Name: Billy Gohl
Nicknames: Ghoul of Grays Harbor , Billy Montana
Notes: Alleged to have killed from 40 to 140 seamen in Aberdeen, Washington
Weapon: gun, pistol, shot, shooting, fire, burned

Name: Bloody Benders
Nicknames: John Bender Sr.Elvira Bender, Kate Bender, John Bender Jr.
Notes: The Bender family, more well known as the Bloody Benders, were a family of serial killers in Labette County, Kansas, United States, from May 1871 to December 1872. Estimates report that the Benders killed at least a dozen travelers, and perhaps as many as twenty before they were discovered. The family's fate remains unknown, with theories ranging from a lynching to a successful escape.
Weapon: shot, knife, hammer, strangled, burned, hanged, hanging

Name: Bobby Jack Fowler
Criminal_Penalty: 16 years, 3 months with the possibility of parole
Notes: One murder proven, suspected of up to 20 more. Suspect in the Highway of Tears murders.

Name: Bobby Joe Long
Nicknames: The Classified Ad Rapist, The Adman Rapist
Notes: Known as "The Classified Ad Rapist"; killed 10 women in Tampa Bay, Florida in 1984. Sentenced to death. Executed by lethal injection on 23 May 2019.

Name: Boris Gusakov
Notes: Known as "Student Hunter"; committed 15 sexual assaults, including 5 murders, on girls and young women from 1964 to 1968.
Weapon: blunt object, poison, bomb, tortured, chemical

Name: Boston Strangler
Notes: Although Albert DeSalvo was widely thought to be the Boston Strangler, police and others analysing the case have long doubted the truth of his confession. Sentenced to life for a series of rapes, he was murdered in prison. DeSalvo's body was exhumed for DNA testing, and compared to a substance found on the exhumed body of the Boston Strangler's last victim. In 2001, it was declared not to match, but in 2013 officials announced that improvements in DNA extraction technology produced viable samples from the degraded evidence. DeSalvo's body was reexhumed and found to match.

Name: Brabant Killers
Notes: Gang made up by at least three extremely violent robbers, none of whom was ever identified or apprehended. Their bloodlust increased dramatically in their last year of activity, when they began shooting passersby before a robbery, including children, for no seeming reason. Some have theorized links to Operation Gladio.

Name: Bradley Edwards
Notes: Murders of two young women and the disappearance of a third in 1996 and 1997.

Name: Brian Dugan
Notes: Convicted of murdering 2 girls and a woman between 1983 and 1985.

Name: Briley Brothers
Criminal_Penalty: Linwood and Jamesdeathby electrocutionAnthony, life imprisonment
Notes: Three brothers and an accomplice responsible for 12 murders in the 1970s in Richmond, Virginia.
Weapon: pistol, shot, shooting, stabbed, bat, hanging, car, vehicle

Name: Bruce George Peter Lee
Notes: Epileptic arsonist who killed people in the city of Hull; sentenced to life imprisonment, but was later institutionalized.

Name: Bruce Lindahl
Notes: Accidentally killed himself while stabbing one of his victims; posthumously connected to various rape-murders in Dupage County.

Name: Bruce Mcarthur
Notes: One of the oldest known serial killers, active at 65, he lured men to secret sexual encounters involving drugs and bondage, killed them and dismembered their bodies which he hid in garden planters.

Name: Bulelani Mabhayi
Notes: Known as the "Monster of Thuleni"; killed 20 women and children from 2007 to 2012. Sentenced to 25 life sentences on September 3, 2013.

Name: Cape Town Prostitute Killer
Notes: Unidentified serial killer who, on rainy nights, picked up sex workers and domestic workers in his vehicle, strangled them in parking lots, and dumped their bodies in rural, preselected spots.

Name: Carl Eugene Watts
Notes: Believed to have killed over 80 women in multiple states, in 1982 Watts accepted a plea bargain in Texas in which he would plead guilty to a lesser charge and be granted immunity from murder charges in exchange for providing information on his victims; as a result he confessed to 12 murders and was sentenced to 60 years in prison on the lesser charge. He was sentenced to life imprisonment in separate trials in Michigan in 2004 and 2007, and died of cancer a week after the 2007 sentence was handed down. Watts is now suspected to have killed more than 100 women, which would make him the most prolific serial killer in American history.
Weapon: knife, stabbed, stabbing, strangulation, choked, drowned, drowning, car, vehicle, tortured

Name: Carl Gromann
Nicknames: Jack the Slaughterer, The Berlin Butcher
Notes: Known as "The Berlin Butcher". Killed women and sold their flesh on the black market. Only one body found. Hanged himself in his cell after being sentenced to death.

Name: Carl Panzram
Nicknames: Jefferson Baldwin  Cooper John II  Harry Panzram  Jack Allen  Jefferson Davis Jefferson Rhodes  John King  John O,Leary  John Ape
Notes: From 1920 to 1928, he claimed in a posthumous autobiography to have committed over 22 killings, and sodomy of more than 1000 young men. Executed in 1930 by hanging.
Weapon: revolver, pistol, shot, stabbing, strangled, burned, drowned, hanging, tortured

Name: Carlton Gary
Nicknames: Carl Michaels, Michael David, The Stocking Strangler
Notes: Gary was convicted of raping and strangling three elderly women in Columbus, Georgia between 1977 and 1978, although police and prosecutors believe him to be responsible for up to seven rape-murders in Columbus. DNA also linked him to an additional murder in Syracuse, New York, but prosecutors did not charge him because he was already on death row.

Name: Caroline Grills
Nicknames: Aunty Carrie, Aunt Thally, whilst imprisoned
Notes: Poisoned four people (most of them relatives) with thallium hidden in tea and scones she had given them in Sydney. Sentenced to five consecutive life sentences (including one for attempting to poison another family member); died from peritonitis in 1960.

Name: Carroll Cole
Notes: Killed 16 people in California, Nevada, and Texas. Executed by lethal injection in 1985.

Name: Cary Stayner
Nicknames: The Yosemite Park Killer, The Yosemite Killer
Notes: Known as "The Yosemite Killer". Killed four women in Yosemite, California. Sentenced to death. Brother of kidnapping victim Steven Stayner.
Weapon: shot, strangled, fire, burned, decapitated, car, vehicle, truck

Name: Castration Serial Murders
Notes: Unidentified perpetrator who kidnapped young men, castrated them and shot them in the back of the head. Forensics proved at least two of the victims were killed by the same person.

Name: Cayetano Santos Godino
Notes: Known as Petiso Orejudo ("the Big-eared Midget"). Teenage arsonist, animal killer and child murderer with congenital syphilis. Arrested at age 16 in 1912 for killing 4 children, although he tried to kill seven more, the first one when he was seven himself. Interned in 1913 in a reformatory, where he tried to kill other immates, and from 1915 in prison. Died in jail in 1948.

Name: Cedric Maake
Notes: Known as the "Wemmer Pan Killer" and "Hammer Killer". He killed his victims with different instruments such as guns, rocks, a knife, and a hammer. Authorities attributed the murders to two serial killers because of the inconsistent modus operandi. In some cases he killed his victims with a rock, in others he shot them, and in others he murdered tailors with a hammer. Maake was arrested after Moses Sithole was found guilty of 38 killings and sentenced to 1,340 years in prison.

Name: Celine Lesage
Notes: Killed seven of her newborn babies and sentenced to 15 years in prison.

Name: Charles Albanese
Notes: Albanese poisoned his wife's mother and grandmother and his father with arsenic in order to obtain inheritance money, and unsuccessfully tried to poison his brother and mother. He was sentenced to death in two separate trials and ultimately executed in 1995.

Name: Charles Cullen
Notes: Nurse in New Jersey and Pennsylvania who murdered at least 29 patients between 1988 and 2003, but experts believe the number could be as high as 400. Cullen has admitted to more murders, which authorities believe are likely, but the murders cannot be verified due to lack of records.

Name: Charles Ray Hatcher
Nicknames: Albert Aire, Richard Clark, Richard Mark Clark, Richard Martin Clark, Richard Lee Grady, Richard Harris, Carl L. Kalebough, Earl L. Kalebough, Doris Mullins, Hobart Prater, Albert Ralph Price, Richard Lee Price, Ronald Springer, Charles Marvin Tidwell, Doris Mullins Travis, Dwayne Lee Wilfong
Criminal_Penalty: life imprisonment without the possibility of parole for 50 years
Notes: A habitual criminal, confessed to the rape and murder of over 20 young and adolescent males. Escaped from prison several times and was declared a "manipulative institutionalized sociopath". Sentenced to life; killed himself by hanging himself in prison in 1984.

Name: Charles Schmid
Nicknames: The Pied Piper of Tucson, Smitty
Notes: Known as "The Pied Piper of Tucson"; murdered three teenage girls in 1964 and 1965 and buried them in the desert.

Name: Charles Sobhraj
Nicknames: Bikini Killer, Splitting Killer, The Serpent
Criminal_Penalty: 12 years (c. 1975)10 years (c. 1987), life imprisonment (2004)1 year (2010)20 years (2014)
Notes: French con man known as "The Bikini Killer" or "The Serpent" that targeted Western tourists in vacation spots of South-east Asia, often with the help of female accomplices. Imprisoned in India from 1976 to 1997, and sentenced to life imprisonment in Nepal in 2004. He was released from prison in Nepal in 2022.
Weapon: strangled, poisoned, burned, burnt, drowned, drowning, car, vehicle

Name: Charlie Brandt
Notes: Killed himself by hanging after murdering his wife and niece. The latter was also decapitated and eviscerated in a manner strongly similar to 26 unsolved murders of women in Florida, starting in 1973, the year Brandt moved to the state. Brandt was later considered the culprit in one of these murders, due to his strong resemblance to a suspect who was filmed by a traffic camera near the place where one body was found. Rogers was convicted and sentenced to death by electric chair in Florida in 1997 for the stabbing death of Tina Marie Cribbs. He was later convicted and given a second death penalty in California for the September 1995 murder of Sandra Gallagher. Also known as the "Casanova Killer", Rogers is the lone suspect in the stabbing deaths of two other women (Linda Price in Jackson, Mississippi and Andy Jiles Sutton in Bossier City, Louisiana), both of whom—like Cribbs and Gallagher—he'd met and befriended in bars. The earliest homicide Rogers is suspected of is that of an elderly Ohio man, Mark Peters, with whom Rogers had lived for a short time. In 1994, Peters' remains were discovered in a Rogers "family cabin" in Kentucky.

Name: Javed Iqbal
Notes: Child-murderer and rapist, known as "Kukri", Iqbal murdered 100 street children by strangling them and covering up his crimes by dissolving the bodies with acid. He was arrested in December 1999 after sending a letter to a newspaper, and was set to be executed in the manner described by the judge, who stated, "You will be strangled to death in front of the parents whose children you killed" and, "Your body will then be cut into 100 pieces and put in acid, the same way you killed the children." However, he died in custody before he could be executed.

Notes: Carried out the Peterborough ditch murders. Over a period of two weeks, murdered her landlord and two of her house mates by stabbing them. The bodies of three of Christie's victims were found in a wallpaper-covered kitchen alcove soon after Christie moved out of Rillington Place during March 1953. The remains of two more victims were discovered in the garden, and his wife's body was found beneath the floorboards of the front room. Christie was arrested and convicted of his wife's murder, for which he was hanged.

Name: John Cooper

Police believed he killed at least one other woman in 1989, and investigated the possibility he could also have been responsible for another double shotgun murder in Bridgend in 1993. A forensic pathologist also claimed to police that he could have been responsible for two murders of elderly siblings in Pembrokeshire in 1976.

Martin was also alleged to have killed at least three more people in other countries, such as the US, but these were unconfirmed. He was arrested in Changi Airport when he returned to Singapore on 19 March 1995, and was charged with murder. Martin was found guilty of the one murder he committed in Singapore and thus sentenced to death in November 1995. Pacciani's two alleged accomplices, Mario Vanni and Giancarlo Lotti, were sentenced to life and 30 years in prison, respectively. Name: Nikolai Dudin

Name: Nikolai Shestakov

Bernardo has also been suggested as a suspect in a 1991 death with similarities to his modus operandi, and is the prime suspect in the 1990 disappearance and probable murder of Elizabeth Bain, which her boyfriend Robert Baltovich was wrongly convicted of before being exonerated in 2008.

Name: Paul Dennis Reid

Name: Paul Denyer

Notes: Child-murderer and rapist, known as "The Monster of the Andes". López targeted young girls, between the ages of eight and twelve. Arrested in 1980 and convicted in 1983 of killing three young girls, but claimed to have killed hundreds. Despite being believed to be one of the most prolific serial killers of the twentieth century, he was released in the late 1990s.

Name: Pedro Pablo Nakada Ludena

Name: Pedro Rodrigues Filho
Criminal_Penalty: 30 years imprisonment (1973 to 2007), 8 years imprisonment (7 served on good behavior, 2011 to 2018)
Notes: Rodrigues Filho claimed to have killed over 100 victims, 47 of them inmates. He also killed his father (who had killed his mother) and ate a piece of his heart. He killed his first two victims at the age of 14. He was first arrested in 1973; he was convicted and sentenced to 128 years, but the maximum one can serve in Brazil is 30 years. He was released in 2018. He was murdered by two men in 2023.

Name: Peng Miaoji, Ding Yunjia And Su Xiaoping
Notes: Fleeing to Shaanxi, Jiangsu, Anhui, and Henan provinces and 21 provinces and cities 33 administrative villages; during 38 burglaries, killed 77 people, seriously injured three others.

Name: Peter Bryan
Notes: A paranoid schizophrenic, Bryan was recluded in a mental institution after killing a shop assistant with a hammer in 1993. Released 11 years later after psychiatrists noted his "continued improvement", Bryan immediately killed a friend and was apprehended when he was frying his brains on a pan. Months later, Bryan killed a fellow mental patient, declaring that he didn't eat him solely because he was caught first. Currently imprisoned for life.

Name: Peter Dupas
Notes: Sexual sadist from Melbourne, who murdered three women and is suspected of at least three further killings. Was convicted of 16 separate acts of sexual violence before his first murder charge. Serving three consecutive life sentences without the possibility of parole.

Name: Peter Kudzinowski

Name: Peter Kurten

Notes: Killed his mother in 1991, then killed his mistress and her two children 9 years later; Sentenced to prison.

Notes: Hanged in 1958 after being convicted of seven murders at a sensational trial in Glasgow, may have committed two more.

Name: Peter Moore
Notes: Stabbed and mutilated four men. Imprisoned for life since 1996.

Name: Peter Sutcliffe
Notes: Killed at least 13 women between 30 October 1975 and 17 November 1980. Most victims were killed by a combination of bludgeoning and stabbing, and all but two were killed in the county of Yorkshire. Owing to the modus operandi and location of the murders, Sutcliffe became known as the "Yorkshire Ripper." Sentenced to 20 concurrent life sentences. After three years he was sent to a secure psychiatric facility, where he served 25 years before being found "fit to leave" in 2009. Government officials and courts ruled in 2010 that he would never be released. In 2015, he was declared "no longer mentally ill", and transferred to a maximum security prison. After his 1981 conviction police investigated 60 unsolved murders and attempted murders across Britain they thought Sutcliffe could be responsible for, but were able to eliminate him from 40. He has since also been linked by several investigators to the murder of Carol Wilkinson, for which an innocent man spent many years in prison. Sutcliffe died in hospital on 13 November 2020 at age 74, after being diagnosed with COVID-19.
Weapon: knife, stabbed, hammer, hanging, car, vehicle

Name: Peter Tobin

Notes: Believed to have committed the Texarkana Moonlight Murders in Texas between February 23 and May 4, 1946.

Notes: convicted of killing five women in California and Utah between 1978 and 1991. Sentenced to death in 1994.

Name: Pierre Chanal

Name: Polatbay Berdaliyev And Abduseit Ormanov
Notes: Raped, robbed and murdered women along desolate roads; both sentenced to life imprisonment in both countries.

Name: Rabidin Satir
Notes: Nicknamed "Rambo Bentong". Rabidin had raped and murdered a 17-year-old schoolgirl Annie Kok Yin Cheng in March 2009 and battered 31-year-old forestry department employee Khairul Hazri Jamaludin to death in November 2012. Rabidin was convicted of both these murders and given two death sentences in 2014 and 2015 respectively. Rabidin was suspected of killing three to four more people: a nine-year-old girl, an elderly married couple in their 70s and a 63-year-old man between 2010 and 2012.

Name: Radik Tagirov

Name: Rainbow Maniac
Notes: Unidentified serial killer who shot gay men in the head (except one, who was bludgeoned) in the Paturis Park of Carapicuiba.

Name: Ramadan Abdel Rehim Mansour
Notes: Mansour was a gang leader known as "al-Tourbini" ("The Express Train"). He had raped and tortured homeless children, mostly boys aged 10 to 14 years old, aboard the trains between Cairo, Alexandria, Qalyubia, and Beni Sueif. The victims were usually thrown off the moving train when they were dead or in agony; other times, they were thrown into the Nile or buried alive. Mansour was executed in 2010.

Name: Raman Raghav
Nicknames: The Ripper, Sindhi Dalwai, Talwai, Anna, Thambi, Veluswami, Psycho Raman
Notes: In the late 1960s, Raghav went on a violent rampage in Mumbai, India. He bludgeoned 41 people to death inside their shelters while they slept. He died of kidney failure in 1995.

Name: Randy Steven Kraft

Name: Raya And Sakina And Their Husbands
Notes: Gang of four that rented a house for women and killed them to rob their money and jewellery. Raya and Sakina were the first women executed in the modern state of Egypt, in 1921.

Name: Raymond Fernandez And Martha Beck

Both were arrested in Michigan in 1949 for the murders of a woman and her two-year-old daughter, but Michigan authorities waived prosecution and extradited the pair to New York to face trial for a murder that occurred there because New York had the death penalty while Michigan did not. They were convicted of that murder and executed in 1951.

Name: Raymond Morris
Nicknames: The A34 murders, Babes in the Ditch murders, The Half-Day murders

Name: Richard Ramirez

Name: Robert George Clements
Notes: Believed to have murdered his four wives, all of whom died young and had their death certificates signed by Clements himself. Clements committed suicide with a morphine overdose when police came to arrest him for the murder of his fourth wife, who had died of the same cause.

Notes: Alias Robot Gedek. Homeless man that killed 12 boys. Sentenced to death on May 21, 1997. Died in prison on March 26, 2007.

Name: Steve Wright
Notes: Referred to as "Suffolk murders", "Ipswich murders", "Ipswich Ripper", "Suffolk Ripper", "Suffolk Strangler", "East Anglia Ripper", "Red Light Ripper" and "the Suffolkator". Name: Steven Brian Pennell

There are also suspicions that due to the heavy use of pancuronium bromide, scoline and potassium chloride in 1998–2001, the number of victims could be as high as 1200.

Name: The Stoneman

Name: Thierry Paulin

Criminal_Penalty: 13 life sentence(s) (208 years for armed robbery)
Notes: Known as the "Sugar cane serial killer", he murdered 13 women. Convicted in 2010.

Name: Tiago Henrique Gomes Da Rocha
Notes: Gomes da Rocha was a Brazilian security guard who confessed to the murders of 39 people. He was sentenced to 25 years in prison for 11 murders, and attempted suicide while incarcerated.

Name: Tillie Klimek

Name: Timothy Krajcir

Name: Timothy Wilson Spencer

Name: Vera Renczi

Renczi is one of the world's most prolific female serial killers. However, there is very little information about Renczi and her crimes, because personal information (criminal history, academic records, etc.) were not cataloged as well as they are today, making some criminologists believe she was a figure of Romanian folklore, rather than an actual person.

Name: Very Idham Henyansyah

Sentenced to death.

Name: Viktor Sayenko And Igor Suprunyuk

Nicknames: The American Jack the Ripper, Richard Owen, John Schrader, Jeffrey Shrader
Notes: Known as "The American Jack the Ripper"; murdered and mutilated three women and one man; Canadian and US authorities also investigated him as a suspect in a total of ten murders, but he died before any of these claims could be confirmed.
Weapon: shot, shooting, knife, stabbed, strangled, decapitated

Name: William Heirens
Notes: Burglar who stabbed three females between. Known as "The Lipstick Killer".

Name: William Henry Hance
Nicknames: Chairman of the Forces of Evil
Notes: Hance murdered three women in and around military bases in the late 1970s. He attempted to blame two of the murders on white vigilantes outraged over a series of murders later attributed to Carlton Gary. Hance was also blamed for the murder of a fourth woman at Fort Benjamin Harrison in Indiana but was never brought to trial for this crime.

Name: William Macdonald
Notes: Murdered derelicts in Sydney and Brisbane between 1960 and 1962; sentenced to five consecutive life sentences.

Name: William Patrick Fyfe
Notes: Convicted of killing five women in the Montreal area of Quebec, although he claims to have killed four others. Serving a life sentence in West Canada.

Name: William Suff
Nicknames: William Lester Suff, The Riverside Prostitute Killer, The Lake Elsinore Killer
Notes: Previously served 10 years of a 70-year sentence for beating his baby daughter to death. Beginning two years after his release, this county store clerk raped, stabbed, strangled, and sometimes mutilated 12 or more sex workers in Riverside County, California. Known as the "Riverside Prostitute Killer" and the "Lake Elsinore Killer." Sentenced to death.
Weapon: gun, knife, stabbed, strangled, strangulation, suffocated, smothered, car, tortured

Name: William Unek
Notes: Unek was a police constable who murdered 21 people with an axe in less than two hours before fleeing. Three years later, Unek, armed with rifle and axe, murdered 36 more people in the village of Malampaka before being mortally wounded by police with a smoke bomb that caught fire.
Weapon: shot, shooting, stabbed, axe, strangled, fire, burned, bomb

Name: Willy Pickton
Notes: Nicknamed "The Butcher"; Robert Pickton was a Canadian serial killer who killed 49 women and disposed of their bodies by feeding them to his pigs. He was convicted of only 6 murders but charged for his proven 49 victims. Unfortunately, much to the anger of the victims families, the remaining 43 charges were stayed or dropped. Sentenced to life.

Name: Wolfgang Abel And Marco Furlan
Notes: The victims, seemingly chosen at random and killed by different methods, were found next to letters written in Italian, signed "Ludwig" and containing Nazi imagery, that gave a reason for why the murder had been committed. Abel and Furlan were arrested in Castiglione delle Stiviere while dousing a crowded discothèque with gasoline and sentenced in 1987 to 30 years in prison for all crimes (later reduced to 27).

Name: Wolfgang Schmidt
Nicknames: Pink Giant, The Beast of Beelitz, Beelitz-Murderer
Criminal_Penalty: 15 years in prison and detention in a psychiatric hospital
Notes: Known as the "Beast of Beelitz". Killed five women and a 3 month old baby from 1989 to 1991. Currently in a psychiatric hospital.

Name: Yang Xinhai
Notes: Known as the "Monster Killer". Yang would enter victims' homes at night and kill using axes, meat cleavers, hammers, and shovels. He was executed by gunshot in 2004.

Name: Yavuz Yapcoglu
Notes: Killed in various cities of Turkey. 18 murders proven and accused of more than 40 by eyewitnesses and relatives. Was sentenced to 74 years in prison.

Name: Yevgeny Chuplinsky
Nicknames: See aliases, The Maniac of Novosibirsk, The Novosibirsk Maniac, The Novosibirsk Ripper, The Policeman Maniac, The Policeman Ripper, The Satanist Maniac, The Occult Maniac, The Siberian Monster, The Siberian Ripper, The Siberian Chikatilo, Chupa-Chups
Notes: Known as the "Novosibirsk Maniac"; killed sex workers in Novosibirsk; despite extensive police search and the capture of another serial killer, he was only arrested in 2016; sentenced to life imprisonment.

Name: Yevgeny Nagorny And Sergei Stavitsky
Notes: Killed clients with expensive cars in their autoshop in order to sell them; sentenced to life imprisonment.

Name: Yevgeny Petrov
Notes: Known as the "Novouralsk Ripper"; a child rapist who kidnapped and killed young girls around Novouralsk, mutilating and burning their corpses afterwards; sentenced to life imprisonment.

Name: Yoo Young-Chul
Notes: Used a hammer to murder mostly older victims, until his focus shifted to the decapitation and mutilation of escorts after being dumped by a girlfriend who worked in that profession. Was sentenced to death and currently incarcerated.

Name: Yoshio Kodaira
Notes: A serial rapist, Kodaira killed his father-in-law in 1932 and seven to 10 women in Japan between 1945 and 1946, engaging in necrophilia after the fifth murder. Previously (1920s) he had been deployed to Northern China as a sailor in the Imperial Japanese Navy, where he was free to target the locals. Hanged in 1949.

Name: Yukio Yamaji
Notes: Murdered his own mother in 2000, and then murdered a 27-year-old woman and her 19-year-old sister in 2005.

Name: Yuri Ivanov
Nicknames: The Ust-Kamenogorsk Maniac, The Silk Factory Killer
Notes: Known as the "Ust-Kamenogorsk Maniac"; Kazakhstani rapist who killed girls and women who spoke negatively of men; executed 1987.

Name: Yvan Keller
Notes: Known as the "Pillow Killer"; killed and robbed old women in France's Alsace region, but also confessed to up to 150 murders, including in Germany and Switzerland; killed himself before trial.

Name: Zdzisaw Marchwicki
Notes: Also known as Vampire of Zagłębie. Killed 14 women in 1964–1970 in Poland's region of Dąbrowa Basin. Zdzisław Marchwicki was most likely the man responsible for the killings; however, his guilt remains in dispute. Executed in 1977.

Name: Zhang Jun
Notes: Robbed 22 stores in several Chinese provinces, killing 28 people in the process. Executed in 2001.

Name: Zhang Yongming
Notes: Sold flesh of his victims as 'ostrich meat' and kept eyeballs in wine. Executed.

Name: Zhou Kehua
Nicknames: Baotouge (Chinese: 爆头哥; lit. ,Mr. Headshot,  or ,Brother Headshot,)
Notes: A former soldier who targeted ATM users. He killed 10 people and evaded the law for eight years, before being shot in a shootout with police after a year-long manhunt.

Name: Zodiac Killer
Notes: Targeted young couples. Remains unsolved but open in the California jurisdictions where the five certain Zodiac murders occurred. Potentially 37 total victims claimed but unverified.
